required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of a Monoclonal Antibody KHK4083 in Moderate Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Multiple Ascending Dose Study (Induction Therapy) & Long-term Extension Therapy of an Anti-OX40 Monoclonal Antibody (KHK4083) in Subjects With Moderately Active UC

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the safety and tolerability of administration of multiple ascending doses of KHK4083 and to select the highest dose tolerated by subjects with moderately active Ulcerative Colitis (UC) followed by a Long-term Extension Therapy (LTE) phase for eligible subjects with a clinical response.

detailed_description.textblock:
A Phase 2, double-blind clinical study of multiple ascending doses of KHK4083 (or placebo) with an Long-term Extension Therapy (LTE) phase will be conducted in approximately 60 randomized adult subjects with moderately active UC who have a documented unsuccessful previous treatment.
The Treatment Period includes double-blind Induction Therapy (12 weeks) and Open-label Therapy (OLE) phase (40 weeks) for eligible subjects at Week 12. Subjects already enrolled in the double-blind, long-term extension (LTE) under preceding versions of the protocol who worsen may be eligible to transition to the OLE up to Week 28.
The Follow Up Period after the last administration will be for up to 16 weeks.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Double-blind Induction Therapy was separated into Part A for administration of multiple ascending IV doses of KHK4083 (or placebo) to subjects in Cohorts 1-3 and Part B for administration of the maximally tolerated dose (as determined in cohorts 1-3) in expansion cohort 4. Subjects in Part A were prohibited from participating in Part B. Subjects in each cohort were randomly assigned in a 3:1 ratio to receive KHK4083 or placebo by IV infusion over 60 minutes (± 10 min.). Each subject received a total of 6 treatments (1 IV infusion per treatment) every 2 weeks from Week 0 (Day 1) to Week 10. Subjects who completed double-blind Induction Therapy (i.e., at least 5 of 6 treatments) and had a clinical response or mucosal healing, as defined above, were eligible to continue in double-blind Long Term Extension Therapy (Weeks 12-52) & after protocol amendment all subjects who received at least 5 of 6 treatments were eligible for Open Label Extension Therapy (Weeks 12-52).
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Treatment-related Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: To determine the safety and tolerability of KHK4083

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Treatment-related Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: To determine the safety and tolerability of KHK4083

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Show Improvement in the Mucosa at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the modified Mayo endoscopy sub-score (mMES), which ranges from 0-3 with higher scores = more severe disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects Who Show Improvement in the Mucosa at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the modified Mayo endoscopy sub-score (mMES), which ranges from 0-3 with higher scores = more severe disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Confirmed Anti-KHK4083 Antibodies (Immunogenicity)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity was assessed by determination of the development of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) against KHK4083.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Achieve Mucosal Healing at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The endoscopic Mayo Score (Mayo endoscopic subscore) evaluates ulcerative colitis stage, based only on endoscopic exploration. The scale ranges from 0 to 3, with higher scores = more severe activity. Mucosal healing is defined as modified Mayo endoscopy sub-score (mMES) of 0 or 1 at Week 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Achieve Mucosal Healing at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The endoscopic Mayo Score (Mayo endoscopic subscore) evaluates ulcerative colitis stage, based only on endoscopic exploration. The scale ranges from 0 to 3, with higher scores = more severe activity. Mucosal healing is defined as modified Mayo endoscopy sub-score (mMES) of 0 or 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Achieve Clinical Improvement at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Improvement will be based on a reduction in the total Mayo Clinic score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Total Mayo Scale Score at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Improvement was based on a reduction (mean change from Baseline [Week 0] to Week 52) in the total Mayo Clinic score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Achieve a Clinical Response at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Clinical Response is a reduction in the total Mayo Clinic score of at least 3 points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Achieve a Clinical Response at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Clinical Response indicates the change from Baseline in the Total Mayo Clinic score <= -3 and the percentage change from Baseline in the Total Mayo Clinic score <= -30% to Week 12, with an accompanying decrease in the rectal bleeding subscore of at least 1 point or an absolute rectal bleeding subscore of <= 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Achieve Clinical Remission at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Clinical remission is defined as a total Mayo Clinic score of ≤ 2 and no subscores > 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Achieve Clinical Remission at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Clinical remission is defined as a total Mayo Clinic score of ≤ 2 and no subscores > 1.

arm_group.description: Subjects received one 1.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatment of KHK4083 every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

Subjects received one 3.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatment of KHK4083 every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

Subjects received one 10.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatment of KHK4083 every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

Subjects received one maximum tolerated dose (10.0 mg/kg) IV infusion treatment of KHK4083 every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

Subjects received one IV infusion treatment of Placebo every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48. Subjects who participated in Open-Label Therapy received KHK4083 instead of placebo.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Investigative sites in the US, Poland, Czech Republic, Russia, Romania, Serbia, and Hungary screened patients from January 2016 until June 2017, with the first patient enrolled in June 2016.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 109 patients were screened during the recruiting period. Subjects were enrolled into the study only if all inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria were fulfilled.

participants_list.participants: Subjects received KHK4083 1.0 mg/kg for 12 weeks
Subjects received KHK4083 3.0 mg/kg for 12 weeks
Subjects received KHK4083 10.0 mg/kg for 12 weeks
Subjects received the maximum tolerated dose of KHK4083 10.0 mg/kg for 12 weeks
10 add'l treatments of KHK4083 (same dose as Induction Therapy) as maintenance therapy.
10 add'l treatments of Open-Label KHK4083 (same dose as Induction Therapy) as maintenance therapy.
10 add'l treatments of Open-Label KHK4083 (same dose as Induction Therapy) as maintenance therapy
10 add'l treatments of Open-Label KHK4083 (same dose as Induction Therapy) as maintenance therapy
10 add'l treatments of Open-Label KHK4083 (same dose as Induction Therapy) as maintenance therapy

group.title: KHK4083 Combined
group.description: The total number of participants analyzed who were randomized to KHK4083 during Induction Therapy.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects received placebo IV infusion treatments from Baseline to Week 12. Subjects who completed double-blind Induction Therapy (i.e., at least five of six treatments) were eligible to enter OLE Therapy and receive 10 treatments of open-label KHK4083 (at the same dose administered to that subject during Induction Therapy) as maintenance therapy. Each subject was to receive one IV infusion every 4 weeks from Week 12 to Week 48.

outcome.population: All subjects who received at least one dose of KHK4083, including 14 subjects initially randomized to placebo and who then continued into Open-Label Extension therapy, where they received the maximum tolerated dose of KHK4083.

Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48. Subjects who participated in Open-Label Therapy received KHK4083 instead of placebo.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Who Achieve Clinical Improvement at Week 12
measure.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Improvement will be based on a reduction in the total Mayo Clinic score.
measure.population: Full analysis set - All randomized subjects who received at least one full dose of investigational product and had a Baseline and at least one post-treatment primary efficacy variable.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Total Mayo Scale Score at Week 52
outcome.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Improvement was based on a reduction (mean change from Baseline [Week 0] to Week 52) in the total Mayo Clinic score.
outcome.population: The overall number of participants is the number in the full analysis set. The number of patients analyzed is the number of patients who had values at the noted visits. There were no subjects in the 10.0 mg/kg KHK4083 group in the LTE Therapy Period. There were no subjects in the 1.0 mg/kg KHK4083 group in the OLE Therapy Period.

group.title: KHK4083 Cohort 1
group.description: Subjects received one 1.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatment of KHK4083 every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

group.title: KHK4083 Cohort 2
group.description: Subjects received one 3.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatment of KHK4083 every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

group.title: KHK4083 Cohorts 3 + 4 Combined
group.description: Subjects received one 10.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatment of KHK4083 every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

group.title: KHK4083 Combined
group.description: The total number of participants analyzed who were randomized to KHK4083 during Induction Therapy.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects received one IV infusion treatment of Placebo every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48. Subjects who participated in Open-Label Therapy received KHK4083 instead of placebo.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Total Mayo Scale Score at Week 52
measure.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Improvement was based on a reduction (mean change from Baseline [Week 0] to Week 52) in the total Mayo Clinic score.
measure.population: The overall number of participants is the number in the full analysis set. The number of patients analyzed is the number of patients who had values at the noted visits. There were no subjects in the 10.0 mg/kg KHK4083 group in the LTE Therapy Period. There were no subjects in the 1.0 mg/kg KHK4083 group in the OLE Therapy Period.

class.title: LTE Period - Week 52 Change from Baseline
OLE Period - Week 52 Change from Baseline

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Who Achieve a Clinical Response at Week 12
outcome.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Clinical Response is a reduction in the total Mayo Clinic score of at least 3 points.
outcome.population: Full analysis set - All randomized subjects who received at least one full dose of investigational product and had a Baseline and at least one post-treatment primary efficacy variable.

group.title: KHK4083 Cohort 1
group.description: Subjects received one 1.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatment of KHK4083 every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

group.title: KHK4083 Combined
group.description: The total number of participants analyzed who were randomized to KHK4083 during Induction Therapy.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects received one IV infusion treatment of Placebo every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48. Subjects who participated in Open-Label Therapy received KHK4083 instead of placebo.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Who Achieve a Clinical Response at Week 12
measure.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Clinical Response is a reduction in the total Mayo Clinic score of at least 3 points.
measure.population: Full analysis set - All randomized subjects who received at least one full dose of investigational product and had a Baseline and at least one post-treatment primary efficacy variable.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Who Achieve a Clinical Response at Week 52
outcome.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Clinical Response indicates the change from Baseline in the Total Mayo Clinic score <= -3 and the percentage change from Baseline in the Total Mayo Clinic score <= -30% to Week 12, with an accompanying decrease in the rectal bleeding subscore of at least 1 point or an absolute rectal bleeding subscore of <= 1.

group.title: KHK4083 Cohort 1
group.description: Subjects received one 1.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatment of KHK4083 every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

group.description: Subjects received one IV infusion treatment of Placebo every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48. measure.title: Number of Subjects Who Achieve a Clinical Response at Week 52
measure.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Clinical Response indicates the change from Baseline in the Total Mayo Clinic score <= -3 and the percentage change from Baseline in the Total Mayo Clinic score <= -30% to Week 12, with an accompanying decrease in the rectal bleeding subscore of at least 1 point or an absolute rectal bleeding subscore of <= 1.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Who Achieve Clinical Remission at Week 12
outcome.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Clinical remission is defined as a total Mayo Clinic score of ≤ 2 and no subscores > 1.

group.title: KHK4083 Cohort 1
group.description: Subjects received one 1.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatment of KHK4083 every two weeks from Week 0 to Week 10 of Induction Therapy. Subjects who chose to continue into extension therapy and were eligible received one IV infusion every 4 weeks (at the same dose as Induction Therapy) from Week 12 to Week 48.

The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Clinical remission is defined as a total Mayo Clinic score of ≤ 2 and no subscores > 1.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Who Achieve Clinical Remission at Week 52
measure.description: The Mayo Clinic Score is comprised of 4 parts: stool frequency, rectal bleeding, endoscopic findings and physician's global assessment, each scored from 0-3. The total score ranges from 0-12 with higher scores indicating increased severity of disease. Clinical remission is defined as a total Mayo Clinic score of ≤ 2 and no subscores > 1.

group.title: KHK4083 Cohort 1
group.description: Subjects who qualify will receive 1.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatments of KHK4083 from Baseline to Week 48.

group.title: KHK4083 Cohort 2
group.description: Subjects who qualify will receive 3.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatments of KHK4083 from Baseline to Week 48.

group.title: KHK4083 Cohort 3
group.description: Subjects who qualify will receive 10.0 mg/kg IV infusion treatments of KHK4083 from Baseline to Week 48.

group.title: KHK4083 Cohort 4
group.description: Subjects who qualify will receive maximum tolerated dose (10.0 mg/kg) IV infusion treatments of KHK4083 from Baseline to Week 48.

group.title: KHK4083 Combined
group.description: The total number of participants analyzed who were randomized to KHK4083 during Treatment parts A & B.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects received placebo IV infusion treatments from Baseline to Week 12. Subjects who completed double-blind Induction Therapy (i.e., at least five of six treatments) were eligible to enter OLE Therapy and receive 10 treatments of open-label KHK4083 (at the same dose administered to that subject during Induction Therapy) as maintenance therapy. Each subject was to receive one IV infusion every 4 weeks from Week 12 to Week 48.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
